1428015099546152969.name: Marine Neuroscience Laboratory (MNL)
1428015099546152969.tweet: Presenting a record-breaking Tomopteris helgolandica for #WormWednesday: this little guy thrived in our lab for >3 months! This means we can study the behaviour of individuals across weeks.  https://t.co/DEgLdy5mf9

1425510845119873028.name: Yuuki Niimi
1425510845119873028.tweet: Observing the gut activity of a Tomopteris worm #WormWednesday  https://t.co/OjX1AA2BoT

1420571903819878400.name: Demforever
1420571903819878400.tweet: Glow in the dark. Tomopteris Plankton. This sea worm is the only organism capable of yellow bioluminescence. When disturbed, it releases a flurry of glowing sparks from its foot-like appendages that are called parapodia.  https://t.co/gjAhUm8Jrb
